comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: this appears to be taken about a day before his death... he was mounted with a stick pin through his gut and is preserved in a museum drawer....

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A biography of Fabre, 'Fabre, Poet of Science' was reviewed in the NYT of September 21, 1913. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9906E7D6113BE633A... And a July 1912 article query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B03E6DD1630E233A... has the headline "HENRI FABRE DYING OF HUNGER IN FRANCE; Scientist Whom Darwin Regarded as One of World's Greatest Men Is 88 Years Old."
